byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and ERIK ECKHOLM
byline.contributor: Kirk Johnson reported from Burns, and Richard Pérez-Peña and Erik Eckholm from New York. Jack Healy contributed reporting from Denver, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.

lead_paragraph: So far, local, state and federal law enforcement agencies have taken a low-key approach, wary of past confrontations that turned into violent sieges.

headline.print_headline: Occupying Federal Land, to Little Response
headline.main: Cautious Response to Armed Oregon Protest

snippet: So far, local, state and federal law enforcement agencies have taken a low-key approach, wary of past confrontations that turned into violent sieges.
abstract: Group of armed protesters calling itself Citizens for Constitutional Freedom takes over Malheur National Wildlife Refuge in Oregon as part of national movement to force Washington to release its hold on vast tracts of Western land; occupation, which is so far tolerated by federal government, is latest battle in long-running fight between Westerners who make living off the land and federal government that controls much of it.
